description: DEMOLITION OF THE EXISTING GROUND FLOOR REAR EXTENSION AND THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW KITCHEN-DINING FAMILY ROOM AT GROUND FLOOR. SOME INTERNAL REMODELLING ON THE GROUND AND FIRST FLOOR. CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW SECOND FLOOR WITHIN A REFORMED ROOF. NEW PERMEABLE PAVING TO FRONT GARDEN TO ACCOMMODATE CAR PARKING ALONG WITH NEW REFUGE COLLECTION ENCLOSURE, BICYCLE STORE AND INSTALLATION OF AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMP.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:
Drawing no: 2025 OS 100042766(Site Location Plan) Dated 19 March 2025
Drawing no: 8427-A3-P_001(Proposed Site Plan) Dated 18.03.2025 
Drawing no: 8427-A3-P_100(Proposed Ground Floor Plan) Dated 18.03.2025
Drawing no 8427-A3-P_101(Proposed First Floor Plan) Dated 18.03.2025.
Drawing no: 8427-A3-P_102 (Proposed Second Floor Plan) Dated 18.03.2025.
Drawing no: 8427-A3-P_103 (Proposed Roof Plan) Dated 18.03.2025.
Drawing no: 8427-A3-P_200(Proposed Section A-A Plan) Dated 18.03.2025.
Drawing no: 8427-A3-P_300(Proposed Front Elevation Plan and Proposed Rear Elevation Plan.) Dated 18.03.2025 
Drawing no: 8427-A3-P_301(Proposed Northwest Side Elevation Plan and Proposed Southeast Elevation Plan) Dated 18.03.2025.
Drawing no: 8427-A3-P_800(Proposed Perspective of the Rear Elevation Plan Dated 18.03.2025. 
Drawing no: 8427-A3-P_950(ASHP in Acoustic Enclosure located in the front garden) Dated 18.03.2025.  
Drawing no: 8427-A3-P_001 (Proposed Parking Provision) Dated 18.03.2025. 
RDX REPORT  REFERENCE 14500.RP01.PNA.0 PREPARED DATED 12 MAY 2025 
Design and Appearance with Site Photographs

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Noise Levels - The sound levels generated with the ASHP shall comply with the RDA Acoustics, Plant Noise Assessment Reference 145.00.RP01.PNA.0 dated 12 May 2025 

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of adjoining properties and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 and policy D12.1 of the Local Plan 2024.

Condition : 5 - Obscured Glazing - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the dormer windows in the west and east facing side roof elevations shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 6 - No Use of Flat Roof  - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
Advice regarding permeable and porous hardstandings can be found in the document 'Guidance on the Permeable Surfacing of Front Gardens' available at http://www.communities.gov.uk/publications/planningandbuilding/pavingfrontgardens

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works

Condition : 9 - Drainage - Surface water from private land shall not discharge on to the public highway. Details of the drainage system for surface water drainage to prevent the discharge of surface water from private land on to the highway shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works. Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the surface water drainage system shall be completed in accordance with the approved details and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved without delay
